section.name: Manifest commands
section.p: Manifest commands are not the only commands for which an active manifest is required, but the commands in this section are certainly closely linked to the manifest.

tr.td: -m, --manifest-name <manifest-name> (the name of the manifest to activate)

Activates a manifest. During startup, Karma will try and locate the last used manifest. Changing to another manifest can be done using select-manifest. Example : sm -m test-1.0 activates the test-1.0 manifest from the local manifest repository.
Shows the current status of all modules in the active manifest. The command checks online on a modules' respective location, if a patch (newer version) is available.
